abstract: Tomar Coke of the Bronx receives aid from Jewish Board Bronx Real program to help her manage her mental illness; Jewish Board is beneficiary agency of UJA-Federation of New York, one of seven organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
lead_paragraph: Tomar Coke, whose depression began as a teenager, is raising two young sons with developmental disabilities and a newborn daughter by herself.

headline.main: Dreaming of a Southern Life, but First, Her Education
headline.print_headline: Dreams of Southern Life, but First, Her Education

snippet: Tomar Coke, whose depression began as a teenager, is raising two young sons with developmental disabilities and a newborn daughter by herself.
